meanings.sent1: The backmost seat on the bus is usually the least crowded.
meanings.sent2: The backmost row in the classroom is where the teacher keeps extra supplies.
meanings.sent3: The backmost squirrel in line kept forgetting where the acorns were buried.
meanings.sent4: Her backmost thoughts were always filled with nostalgia for her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The backmost star in the sky twinkled faintly against the darkness.

meanings.sent1: The backmost door of the house led to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The backmost car in the train was painted bright red.
meanings.sent3: The backmost cat in the family loved to nap in the sun all day.
meanings.sent4: His backmost memories of the town were of laughter and joy.
meanings.sent5: The backmost tree in the forest stood tall and proud, untouched by the storm.

meanings.definition: Last in a sequence or order.
meanings.sent1: The backmost player in the team always gave their best effort.
meanings.sent2: The backmost book on the shelf was the one she had been searching for.
meanings.sent3: The backmost cookie in the jar mysteriously disappeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her backmost dream was to travel the world and see new places.
meanings.sent5: The backmost piece of the puzzle finally completed the picture.
